title: Anyone else experiencing login issues?
body: So, this morning I had a couple games of league after the patch. And now, for whatever reason, I can't connect to the login queue. I had d/ced from the client beforehand but my Internet has been mostly good all morning. Any reason why this is happening?

replies.body: I'm not currently seeing any issues with authentication servers, but keep in mind it's patch day so there could have been some hiccups overnight.  Everything looks okay currently, though!

Still having the issue. Turned off firewall, reset internet, tried other basic troubleshooting. Deleted my WTF folder and reinstalled WoW. Literally everything has been tried and nothing is working.

Do we have any info on the fix? I had this happen at Kayn release patch too but it worked after a few hours of on-and-off attempts. So far, as of 7.15, I haven't been able to log in.
same here... deactivating the firewall doesnÂ´t fix it for me and my lol party
I couldn't log in after the patch, and I found that adding LoL to my firewall's exception list fixed the issue.
randomly back in. just kept spamming log in

Just made sure my firewall, adapters and everything else I could think of were allowed and updated and still no love. Hopefully we are not penalised for leaving our games, I'm not really sure how that works.

I am having the same  issue.

Update: Working now
I am having the same issue. Lost connection during queue and now can't get past "unable to connect to the login queue." Hopefully it's fixed up shortly.
Same, really. I'm kinda glad that I'm not the only person experiencing this atm. But it sucks. I also hope it's fixed soon

Same here. Logged on without problems, joined a ranked game (I'm on my promos...). Selected my champ, and suddenly, the game disconnects me and now I can't connect again. Maybe is the same problem that happened few weeks before (Spark user).
I am having the same issue. Lost connection during queue and now can't get past "unable to connect to the login queue." Hopefully it's fixed up shortly.
